result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence H Jamison Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees, including all mandatory surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law.
No illegal substances.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Third party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence H Jamison Sr

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original Sentencing Hearing Transcript (27 pages) commencing 070/8/2014 by Nancy Czerniejewski.
per request of court reporter.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 03-10-2014 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY ANDREW GOLDEN.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 134 days served.  Court ordered 12 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 24 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No illegal substances; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees, including all mandatory surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Andrew J Golden.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Domestic Abuse, While Armed, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.30(2), 968.075(1)(a), 939.63(1)(c), a Class G Felony.
from the state received and filed.  rmm
from the state received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Andrew J Golden.  Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/09/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
from the defense received and filed.   rmm
from the defense received and filed.   rmm
from the defense received and filed.   rmm
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Andrew J. Golden.  Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in custody.  Kristin Schrank for Molly Marie Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Paul Miner.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.   Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Alice S or LHJ dob 10/6/11

Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Lawrence H Jamison in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
